title: How to Make Gluten‐Free Zucchini Bread

steps.headline: Whisk your dry ingredients together.
steps.description: Pour your 300 grams (1 1/2 cups) of granulated sugar, 283 grams (2 1/2 cups) of white rice flour, 57 grams (1/2 cup) of cornstarch, 1 tablespoon of ground cinnamon, 2 teaspoons of baking soda, 1 1/2 teaspoons of salt, 1 teaspoon of xanthan gum, 1 teaspoon of ground ginger, and 1/4 teaspoon of ground cloves to a large mixing bowl and stir it together with a whisk. Continue mixing everything together for around 5-7 minutes, or until all of the ingredients have been incorporated thoroughly.

steps.headline: Blend eggs, oil, and apple juice into your dry mixture.
steps.description: Blend the wet ingredients together in a food processor or by hand in a separate bowl. Continue to mix the ingredients together until the mixtures resemble a milkshake. Once the batter is well-mixed, add it to your dry mixture and whisk the ingredients together until the dry and wet ingredients have been incorporated with one another.

steps.headline: Add your zucchini, nuts, and raisins to the mix and fold it.
steps.description: Mix in your zucchini and the rest of your optional ingredients and fold the batter until they are evenly distributed throughout the batter. Before adding the zucchini to your bread batter, make sure that it is dry. Dry your zucchini by patting them down with a paper towel and leaving them at room temperature for 10 minutes to dry.

steps.headline: Divide the batter into two mixing pans.
steps.description: Pour the mixture evenly into two separate 9" x 5" loaf pans. Smooth the top of each of your loaves of bread with a spatula for a clean looking baked bread.

steps.headline: Bake your bread in the oven at 325°F for 50 minutes.
steps.description: Bake both of your loaves in a preheated oven. Turn each of the loaves halfway through cooking so that the bread cooks evenly throughout. To achieve the same baking, make sure that each of the bread pans are on the same oven rack. If you are making muffins rather than a loaf of bread, cooking times should be reduced to 20-25 minutes.

steps.headline: Allow the bread to cool for 15-30 minutes before serving it.
steps.description: Once your bread is golden brown on the surface and you can poke it with a toothpick, it's ready to come out of the oven. Take it out and allow it to cook on an oven rack for 5-10 minutes before transferring it to a plate and allowing it to cool further. Your bread can also be wrapped and frozen for up to three months.

methods.name: Baking Chocolate Chip Gluten-Free Zucchini Bread

steps.headline: Mix your dry ingredients in a bowl.
steps.description: Combine your 1 1/2 cups (210 g) of gluten-free flour, 1/2 teaspoon of xanthan gum, 1/2 teaspoon of kosher salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda together in a large mixing bowl. Add the 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, and teaspoon of ground cinnamon bowl and whisk. Continue to stir the dry ingredients until they are well-mixed.

steps.headline: Toss chocolate chips with 1 teaspoon of the dry mix.
steps.description: In a separate bowl, combine the chocolate chips with a teaspoon of the flour mixture. Mix these together with your hands or a bowl until all of the chips are coated in the dry mixture.

steps.headline: Add granulated sugar and brown sugar to your flour mixture.
steps.description: Combine 1/2 cup (100 g) granulated sugar and 1/2 cup (109 g) of brown sugar to the flour bowl and mix it with a spoon. Break up larger pieces of the brown sugar until everything is a fine dust.

steps.headline: Add 1 1/4 cups (125 g) of grated zucchini to your flour bowl.
steps.description: Add some of your grated zucchini to the dry mixture bowl before tossing it to cover all of the pieces. Continue to mix it until the zucchini is evenly distributed in the flour mixture.

steps.headline: Combine the remaining zucchini, eggs, vanilla, and oil.
steps.description: Use the remaining 7/8 cups (88 g) of grated zucchini to make the wet mixture. Pulse the ingredients on medium in a food processor until they are well incorporated and the mixture is smooth.

steps.headline: Create a well in the dry ingredients and pour your puree into it.
steps.description: You can make a well in your flour mixture by pushing flour up to the sides and leaving an empty space in the middle of the mix. Once the well is formed, pour your wet mixture into the dry flour mixture. Mix it together with a whisk until it forms a batter.

steps.headline: Mix your chocolate chips and zucchini into the batter.
steps.description: Pour half of your chocolate chips and all of your zucchini into the batter and fold it until it's mixed well. The other half of your chocolate chips should be saved so that you can coat the top of your loaf of bread with them.

steps.headline: Pour the bread batter into a greased loaf pan.
steps.description: Use a standard 9" x 5" loaf pan when making this bread. The mixture should still be somewhat watery. Use a spatula to get the remaining dough from the bowl and pour it into your loaf pan. When all of the batter has been transferred, smooth the top with a spatula.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the remaining chocolate chips on top.
steps.description: Take the rest of your chocolate chips and scatter them on the top of your zucchini bread's surface. Press the chips down into the bread using a spatula so that they are embedded in the bread's surface. When the bread is finished cooking, it will produce a delicious looking, chocolate chip covered surface for your bread.

steps.headline: Place the baking sheet in the oven at 325°F for 50 minutes.
steps.description: Make sure that your oven is properly preheated before placing your bread into it or else your baking times will be off and your bread may come out underdone. Rotate the bread halfway through cooking so that it cooks evenly throughout. Your bread will be done when the surface is a golden brown. You can also push a toothpick into the bread to check for doneness. The toothpick should have baked bread crumbs on it, not wet batter.

steps.headline: Remove the bread from your oven and let it cool for 15-30 minutes.
steps.description: Once your bread is done cooking, allowing it to cool will let the center of the bread set and finish cooking. Once you've allowed it to cool, use a knife to cut the bread into slices.

text: Baking Basic Gluten-Free Zucchini Bread Whisk your dry ingredients together. Pour your 300 grams (1 1/2 cups) of granulated sugar, 283 grams (2 1/2 cups) of white rice flour, 57 grams (1/2 cup) of cornstarch, 1 tablespoon of ground cinnamon, 2 teaspoons of baking soda, 1 1/2 teaspoons of salt, 1 teaspoon of xanthan gum, 1 teaspoon of ground ginger, and 1/4 teaspoon of ground cloves to a large mixing bowl and stir it together with a whisk. Continue mixing everything together for around 5-7 minutes, or until all of the ingredients have been incorporated thoroughly. Blend eggs, oil, and apple juice into your dry mixture. Blend the wet ingredients together in a food processor or by hand in a separate bowl. Continue to mix the ingredients together until the mixtures resemble a milkshake. Once the batter is well-mixed, add it to your dry mixture and whisk the ingredients together until the dry and wet ingredients have been incorporated with one another. Add your zucchini, nuts, and raisins to the mix and fold it. Mix in your zucchini and the rest of your optional ingredients and fold the batter until they are evenly distributed throughout the batter. Before adding the zucchini to your bread batter, make sure that it is dry. Dry your zucchini by patting them down with a paper towel and leaving them at room temperature for 10 minutes to dry. Divide the batter into two mixing pans. Pour the mixture evenly into two separate 9" x 5" loaf pans. Smooth the top of each of your loaves of bread with a spatula for a clean looking baked bread. Bake your bread in the oven at 325°F for 50 minutes. Bake both of your loaves in a preheated oven. Turn each of the loaves halfway through cooking so that the bread cooks evenly throughout. To achieve the same baking, make sure that each of the bread pans are on the same oven rack. If you are making muffins rather than a loaf of bread, cooking times should be reduced to 20-25 minutes. Allow the bread to cool for 15-30 minutes before serving it. Once your bread is golden brown on the surface and you can poke it with a toothpick, it's ready to come out of the oven. Take it out and allow it to cook on an oven rack for 5-10 minutes before transferring it to a plate and allowing it to cool further. Your bread can also be wrapped and frozen for up to three months. Baking Chocolate Chip Gluten-Free Zucchini Bread Mix your dry ingredients in a bowl. Combine your 1 1/2 cups (210 g) of gluten-free flour, 1/2 teaspoon of xanthan gum, 1/2 teaspoon of kosher salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda together in a large mixing bowl. Add the 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, and teaspoon of ground cinnamon bowl and whisk. Continue to stir the dry ingredients until they are well-mixed. Toss chocolate chips with 1 teaspoon of the dry mix. In a separate bowl, combine the chocolate chips with a teaspoon of the flour mixture. Mix these together with your hands or a bowl until all of the chips are coated in the dry mixture. Add granulated sugar and brown sugar to your flour mixture. Combine 1/2 cup (100 g) granulated sugar and 1/2 cup (109 g) of brown sugar to the flour bowl and mix it with a spoon. Break up larger pieces of the brown sugar until everything is a fine dust. Add 1 1/4 cups (125 g) of grated zucchini to your flour bowl. Add some of your grated zucchini to the dry mixture bowl before tossing it to cover all of the pieces. Continue to mix it until the zucchini is evenly distributed in the flour mixture. Combine the remaining zucchini, eggs, vanilla, and oil. Use the remaining 7/8 cups (88 g) of grated zucchini to make the wet mixture. Pulse the ingredients on medium in a food processor until they are well incorporated and the mixture is smooth. Create a well in the dry ingredients and pour your puree into it. You can make a well in your flour mixture by pushing flour up to the sides and leaving an empty space in the middle of the mix. Once the well is formed, pour your wet mixture into the dry flour mixture. Mix it together with a whisk until it forms a batter. Mix your chocolate chips and zucchini into the batter. Pour half of your chocolate chips and all of your zucchini into the batter and fold it until it's mixed well. The other half of your chocolate chips should be saved so that you can coat the top of your loaf of bread with them. Pour the bread batter into a greased loaf pan. Use a standard 9" x 5" loaf pan when making this bread. The mixture should still be somewhat watery. Use a spatula to get the remaining dough from the bowl and pour it into your loaf pan. When all of the batter has been transferred, smooth the top with a spatula. Sprinkle the remaining chocolate chips on top. Take the rest of your chocolate chips and scatter them on the top of your zucchini bread's surface. Press the chips down into the bread using a spatula so that they are embedded in the bread's surface. When the bread is finished cooking, it will produce a delicious looking, chocolate chip covered surface for your bread. Place the baking sheet in the oven at 325°F for 50 minutes. Make sure that your oven is properly preheated before placing your bread into it or else your baking times will be off and your bread may come out underdone. Rotate the bread halfway through cooking so that it cooks evenly throughout. Your bread will be done when the surface is a golden brown. You can also push a toothpick into the bread to check for doneness. The toothpick should have baked bread crumbs on it, not wet batter. Remove the bread from your oven and let it cool for 15-30 minutes. Once your bread is done cooking, allowing it to cool will let the center of the bread set and finish cooking. Once you've allowed it to cool, use a knife to cut the bread into slices. Finished.
tyn_model: baking chocolate chip gluten-free zucchini bread
